DrugName: Pain relief medication (e.g., acetaminophen or ibuprofen) for managing chest pain and discomfort
Antiemetic medication (e.g., ondansetron) to prevent nausea and vomiting associated with pancreatitis
Proton pump inhibitor (e.g., omeprazole) to reduce risk of gastrointestinal bleeding and facilitate ulcer healing
Lipase inhibitors (e.g., colestyramine) to manage hyperlipidemia and inflammation in pancreatitis
Antibiotics (e.g., ciprofloxacin or metronidazole) as empirical treatment for potential infections in pancreatitis
H2 blockers (e.g., ranitidine) for managing gastric acid secretion and preventing stress ulcers
Corticosteroids (e.g., methylprednisolone) to reduce inflammation and facilitate pancreatic healing
Thiamine supplementation to prevent thiamine deficiency and Wernicke's encephalopathy in malnourished patients
Vitamin C supplementation to support collagen synthesis and wound healing
